front: Match the following networking terms with their descriptions:
back:
Twisted-pair copper cables → Network media using pairs of insulated copper wires twisted together.
Fiber-optic cables → Network media using glass or plastic threads to transmit data as light.
Coaxial cables → Network media with a central conductor surrounded by insulation and a shield.
Wireless → Network media that transmits data through the air using radio waves.
Ethernet → A common local-area network (LAN) technology for connecting devices using cables.
Switch Virtual Interface (SVI) → A virtual interface on a switch that allows for remote management using IPv4/IPv6.

pairs.right: Network media using pairs of insulated copper wires twisted together.
Network media using glass or plastic threads to transmit data as light.
Network media with a central conductor surrounded by insulation and a shield.
Network media that transmits data through the air using radio waves.
A common local-area network (LAN) technology for connecting devices using cables.
A virtual interface on a switch that allows for remote management using IPv4/IPv6.

front: Match the following networking terms with their descriptions:
back:
DHCP → A protocol that automatically assigns IP addresses, subnet masks, gateways, and DNS settings.
`ipconfig` → A Windows command-line utility to display the IP configuration of a host.
`show ip interface brief` → A command that displays the status and IP configuration of switch interfaces.
`ping` → A command used to test network connectivity by sending ICMP echo requests and replies.
`ip address` → An interface configuration command used to manually assign an IPv4 address to an interface.
`ip default-gateway` → A global configuration command used to assign a default gateway to a switch.

pairs.right: A protocol that automatically assigns IP addresses, subnet masks, gateways, and DNS settings.
A Windows command-line utility to display the IP configuration of a host.
A command that displays the status and IP configuration of switch interfaces.
A command used to test network connectivity by sending ICMP echo requests and replies.
An interface configuration command used to manually assign an IPv4 address to an interface.
A global configuration command used to assign a default gateway to a switch.
